The Pandora Disc & Other Discs With Pandora Qualities
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): CD/DVD List: The Pandora Disc & Other Discs With Pandora Qualities
This thread is for postings of discs with the Pandora Disc charactersistic of creating different monsters at different breeder levels.
This section is closed to new posts.
If you find such a disc, post a thread in the Miscellaneous Q&A section.
Make sure to post names of each breed made at each level, complete with stats.
After several people have confirmed the disc, the listing will be moved here.
By Lisa Shock on Monday, September 17, 2001 - 11:38 am:

General Info


The Pandora disc is a music CD that was given away to people who pre-purchased MR3 from tecmo's website, or who participated in our contest in August/September 2001. It was made in Japan, and has a series of short tracks that give game tips in Japanese. It acts unusually in the shrine, by making several monsters. Bragma notes any Pandora by saying so at the time of shrining.

(You can make a CD with the same properties by using the info in the Laboratory section of this site, along with a CD burner.)

It seems that the monster order is randomly chosen when you first start your game. I have seen at least four different variations of the pattern, (1st monster mocchi, 5th monster rayrin; 1st monster mocchi, 5th monster bealock; 1st monster suezo, 2nd monster Valkyrie, 1st monster suezo, 2nd monster rayrin.) As far as we can tell, there are four constants:

A: The first and Third monsters are always suezo and mocchi (Although not necesarily in that order)
B: The Last Monster is Always Masala (Since durahan isn't unlocked until you reach A rank)
C: The Second, Fourth, and Fifth monsters are always Rayrin, Bealock, and Valkyrie (Although not necesarily in that order)
D: The monsters order is determined at the start of the game, and the only way to get a different order is to start a new game.
E: Skipping a rank and thereby missing a monster does not affect the order.

It looks like the Pandora's disk works slightly different after you beat Ragnorax. It rotates the breeds by season, and there are 4 patterns based on what your starting series was. Here are 2 of the patterns:

Start of game order: Suezo, Rayrin, Mocchi, Valkyrie, Bealock, Masala
After beating Ragnarocks:
Mar-MayBealock
Jun-AugMasala
Sept-NovRayrin
Dec-FebValkyrie


Start of game oder: Suezo, Valkyrie, Mocchi, Rayrin, Bealock, Masala
After beating Raganrocks:
Mar - MayValkyrie
Jun - AugBealock
Sep - NovSuzurin
Dec - FebMasala


For this starting order:
Suezo, Valkyrie, Mocchi, Rayrin, Bealock, Masala
After beating Ragnarox:

Mar - May Valkyrie
Jun - JulBealock
AugKujata
Sep - NovRayrin
Dec - FebMasala


The order that got Kujata and Grupus (from HAB) in November was as follows:
Mocchi - Rayrin - Suezo - Bealock - Valkyrie - Masala.
